This year Venus ISD has teamed up with Cook Children’s School-Based Telemedicine Program. This means our school nurses can connect virtually to a Cook Children’s board-certified pediatrician or certified nurse practitioner from the school nurse’s office. Parents will have the option of joining the virtual visit by logging into a secure website.

The school nurse will assist the provider during the evaluation through the use of special equipment as needed. The provider can hear the student’s heart and lungs with a digital stethoscope. The provider can closely examine the student’s ears, throat, rash, or abrasions with a high definition camera. If needed, electronic prescriptions can be sent to the family’s preferred pharmacy.

At this time, we will not be able to test students for COVID in the schools due to several factors. We will be using a screening tool that will alert us of a potential case and there will be specific instructions on what to do if a child is exhibiting COVID symptoms.

More information on how to register, and the full details of the program will be posted soon.

Debido a los riesgos asociados con la propagación de COVID-19 (coronavirus), Venus ISD no impartirá clases la semana del 23 al 27 de marzo y suspenderá todas las actividades extra curriculares, prácticas, viajes y uso de instalaciones hasta el domingo 29 de marzo. Evaluaremos activamente la situación a lo largo de este tiempo. En caso de que sea necesario cerrar por un período de tiempo adicional, nos comunicaremos con los padres y el personal antes del mediodía del jueves 26 de marzo.

Recomendamos a las familias de Venus ISD que eviten viajar y asistir a reuniones con mucha gente para evitar la propagación del virus. En el caso de que necesitemos facilitar el aprendizaje en línea para nuestros estudiantes, proporcionaremos instrucciones y recursos en ese momento. El sitio web de Venus ISD, www.venusisd.net, se actualizará con la información más actualizada a medida que esté disponible.

Evaluaremos activamente la situación a lo largo de este tiempo. En caso de que sea necesario cerrar por un período de tiempo adicional, nos comunicaremos con los padres y el personal antes del mediodía del jueves 26 de marzo.

Recomendamos a las familias de Venus ISD que eviten viajar y asistir a reuniones con mucha gente para evitar la propagación del virus. En el caso de que necesitemos facilitar el aprendizaje en línea para nuestros estudiantes, proporcionaremos instrucciones y recursos en ese momento. El sitio web de Venus ISD, www.venusisd.net, se actualizará con la información más actualizada a medida que esté disponible.

We will actively evaluate the situation throughout this time. Should there be a need to close for an additional length of time, we will contact parents and staff by noon on Thursday, March 26.

We strongly urge Venus ISD families to avoid travel and attending large gatherings to prevent the spread of the virus. In the event that we need to facilitate online learning for our students, we will provide instructions and resources at that time. The Venus ISD website, www.venusisd.net, will be updated with the most current information as it becomes available.

Today, our high school administration received an alert that a student on campus had a weapon. All campuses were placed on lockdown as a precautionary action. In the meantime, the student and the classroom were quickly isolated and the weapon (not a firearm) was retrieved. At no time were students threatened with violence. A huge thanks to campus administrators and staff, and Venus ISD School Resource Officer as well as Venus PD and Alvarado PD for responding.

Thanks also to all parents for cooperating throughout the short duration of the event. Our labors and prayers are ongoing in the constant effort to provide a safe and effective learning environment for our students.

James Hopper
Superintendent
Venus Independent School District
